column3: High: I evaluate machine translation regularly
column18: Although technically all conditions were met, page would not validate and let me go through. Had to refresh and re-click all several times to make it go through
column30: The page formatting is problematic. Font size differences between source and destination are tiring. Also there's a need for a tool to help auto-highlight the corresponding counter-part (phrase / word / sentence?)in the other text when hovering over the counterpart. Otherwise you lose time re-reading entire paragraphs up and down to identify the wrong or missing words

column3: High: I evaluate machine translation regularly
High: I evaluate machine translation regularly
column18: segments/texts much too long, need to be broken down to much smaller chunks; too many options for labelling (e.g. difference of when to use unintelligible vs. mistranslation not clear)
column30: highlighting text segments could be made easier; built-in timer doesn't work properly

column3: High: I evaluate machine translation regularly
column18: In my point of vie It would be more helpful to be able to comment on the segments. I prefer to tell i.e. "first sentence is missing/not translated". The hovering with mouse (pink an purple) was kind of complicated and time consuming.
column19: Syntax, Grammar, right word but wrong context
column30: After submitting and receiving the confirmation token, the displayed work time was wrong.

column3: High: I evaluate machine translation regularly
column19: sometimes the translation becomes to complex with 20 lines to read
column30: The UI should become more userfriendly when you try to mark some words or whole sentenses

column18: Segments were sometimes just too long and one gets lost somewhere around the middle. It would be nice if they could be at most 5 sentences long.

column3: High: I evaluate machine translation regularly
column18: Mostly the segments were too long - even at 75% screen zoom the English source and German translation did not fit on my screen. It would be great, if the English and German text could be next to each other in columns instead of rows.
column30: No technical issues except for slow uploading sometimes, but the deselecting of highlighted text sometimes did not work

column3: Moderate: I have done it few times

column18: Some document fragments were so long. Over 10 lines and when they were very wrong it was just a mess.
column19: Grammar error / missing text / additional sentences that were not in the source text.

column3: Moderate: I have done it few times
High: I evaluate machine translation regularly
column18: 1) The highlighting function did not work throughout the task, so I was unable to do this part of the task.  2) The task could have taken many hours to complete had I been able to highlight the errors as the texts were almost unintelligible and error-ridden. 3) The texts were also too long. 4) The annotation of errors would prolong the length of the task even further.
column19: Unintelligibility of the source text, length of the source text, the target text often summarised the source text in part.
column30: Yes, I  experienced severe technical faults from start to finish and due to these, I was not able to complete the task properly. I was not able to use the highlight mark-up at all.  For the most part the "missing" button also failed to highlight too.

column3: High: I evaluate machine translation regularly
column18: While the 3-level assessment may work well for a single sentence, it is definjitely not sufficient for longer document-type texts. This is where I typically used the standard 10-level assessment. The highlighting toggle triggered by the mouse click (NO HIGHLIGHT->MINOR ERROR->MAJOR ERROR>NO HIGHLIGHT) was not obvious at all. Untfortunately it has not been mentioned in the guideline. Pre-assessment offered by the customer was at the beginning a challenge, later on I realized that it should just be removed and this is where my assessment can begin.
column19: Occasional lengthy texts, usage of transcript texts, frequent usage of English words/terms in German texts
column30: A tool improvement I can think of is an option to mark missing words/phrases in the source text.

column3: Moderate: I have done it few times
column19: Minor mistakes or weird input data (I would call it sloppy English).

column3: Moderate: I have done it few times
column18: I really enjoyed the method, but it was unclear how much I could trust the marked errors (how they were marked, by who, etc).
column30: No technical issues. I would like more information on the method itself, since it was my first time working with it.

column3: Moderate: I have done it few times

column18: More examples in the tutorial. Especially how to deal better with missing parts.
column19: mistranslation, additions and omissions of text and to lesser extend punctuation.
column30: More examples in the tutorial. Several aspects have not been explained well

column3: High: I evaluate machine translation regularly
column18: The menu for identifying the type of mistake is not practical. You should be able to move forward or backward in it and not have to exit and start again if you went into a wrong heading.
column19: 1) Sentences from other a text repeated in another text. This is difficult to mark, since it it could be seen as a mistranslation or an addition,etc.  2) wrong translations of words and expressions (idioms)  3) Grammar issues (confusion of genders; missing prepositions)
column30: Let one recommend a correct translation

column19: some very long sentences, maybe splitting it into 2-3 shorter sentences would have been easier to read and evaluate
